description: If true, you can only add new Vaccination Status objects.

Vaccination_StatusObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Vaccination_StatusObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Vaccination_StatusObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Vaccination_Status_Data.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.
The name of the worker's vaccination status.

Vaccine_TypeObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Vaccine_TypeObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Vaccine_TypeObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Vaccination_Status_Data.description: Contains the Vaccination Status and their associated data.
The custom text that workers view when they attest to their Vaccination Status.
If true, displays a Vaccination Details section on the Add My Vaccination and Add Vaccination tasks. Enables workers to enter the manufacturer, vaccination event type, and date.
If true, the worker is marked as Fully Vaccinated when they select this Vaccination Status.
If true, the status is inactivated. You might have downstream impacts if there's existing vaccination data.
